claim-text.content: 1. A method comprising:

receiving, at a telecommunications system of an Internet fax system, an inbound fax call having associated therewith a source address, a destination address and a fax signal, wherein the destination address corresponds to a particular subscriber of the Internet fax system;
switching, by the telecommunications system, the inbound fax call to a call mediation system of a plurality of call mediation systems within the Internet fax system;

determining, by the call mediation system, desired fax protocol technical call processing capabilities for processing the fax signal based on a plurality of the source address, the destination address and whether the inbound fax call was received through a circuit-switched or packet-switched connection;

identifying, by the call mediation system a subset of fax processing resources of a plurality of fax processing resources associated with the call mediation system that have the desired fax protocol technical call processing capabilities;
switching, by the call mediation system, the inbound fax call to a selected fax processing resource of the subset of fax processing resources;
translating, by the selected fax processing resource, the fax signal into a digital representation; and
causing the digital representation to be delivered or otherwise made available to one or more users associated with the particular subscriber.

claim.body: switching, by the telecommunications system, the inbound fax call to a call mediation system further comprises performing round-robin load balancing among the plurality of call mediation systems.

content: 2. The method of

, wherein said switching, by the telecommunications system, the inbound fax call to a call mediation system further comprises performing round-robin load balancing among the plurality of call mediation systems.

claim.body: the plurality of call mediation systems comprise a plurality of private branch exchanges (PBXs), wherein said switching, by the telecommunications system, the inbound fax call to a call mediation system comprises switching the inbound fax call to a PBX of the plurality of PBXs and wherein said switching, by the call mediation system, the inbound fax call to a selected fax processing resource comprises calling a digital access cross connect system (DACS) logically interposed between the PBX and the fax processing resource.

content: 3. The method of

, wherein the plurality of call mediation systems comprise a plurality of private branch exchanges (PBXs), wherein said switching, by the telecommunications system, the inbound fax call to a call mediation system comprises switching the inbound fax call to a PBX of the plurality of PBXs and wherein said switching, by the call mediation system, the inbound fax call to a selected fax processing resource comprises calling a digital access cross connect system (DACS) logically interposed between the PBX and the fax processing resource.

claim.body: a decision, by the PBX switch, whether to accept or reject the inbound fax call based on one or more of the source address, the destination address and a specific circuit or packet switched connection through which the inbound fax call was received.
claim.transPhrase: , further comprising prior to said determining, making

content: 4. The method of

, further comprising prior to said determining, making a decision, by the PBX switch, whether to accept or reject the inbound fax call based on one or more of the source address, the destination address and a specific circuit or packet switched connection through which the inbound fax call was received.

claim.body: the PBX remaining in a call path of the inbound fax call until completion of the inbound fax call and upon the completion the PBX recording billing information in a database.

content: 5. The method of
, further comprising the PBX remaining in a call path of the inbound fax call until completion of the inbound fax call and upon the completion the PBX recording billing information in a database.

claim.body: a delivery method to employ in connection with delivery of the digital representation to the one or more users based on the destination address or user account specific preferences associated with the one or more users.

content: 6. The method of

, further comprising determining a delivery method to employ in connection with delivery of the digital representation to the one or more users based on the destination address or user account specific preferences associated with the one or more users.

claim.body: the determined delivery method is electronic mail (email) delivery.

content: 7. The method of
, wherein the determined delivery method is electronic mail (email) delivery.

claim.body: the determined delivery method is delivery via a web site associated with the Internet fax system.

content: 8. The method of
, wherein the determined delivery method is delivery via a web site associated with the Internet fax system.

claim.body: the determined delivery method is delivery via an application programming interface (API) associated with the Internet fax system.

content: 9. The method of
, wherein the determined delivery method is delivery via an application programming interface (API) associated with the Internet fax system.

claim.body: the API supports programmatic listing of a plurality of received faxes and programmatic downloading of a received fax of the plurality of received faxes.

content: 10. The method of
, wherein the API supports programmatic listing of a plurality of received faxes and programmatic downloading of a received fax of the plurality of received faxes.

claim.body: a web services interface of the Internet fax system a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or a HTTP secure (HTTPS) POST generated by an application of the subscriber that conveys a request for a list of received faxes.

content: 11. The method of

, further comprising receiving by a web services interface of the Internet fax system a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or a HTTP secure (HTTPS) POST generated by an application of the subscriber that conveys a request for a list of received faxes.

claim.body: a web services interface of the Internet fax system a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or a HTTP secure (HTTPS) POST generated by an application of the subscriber that conveys a request for retrieval of a particular received fax.

content: 12. The method of

, further comprising receiving by a web services interface of the Internet fax system a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or a HTTP secure (HTTPS) POST generated by an application of the subscriber that conveys a request for retrieval of a particular received fax.

claim.claim_preamble: A non-transitory computer-readable storage medium tangibly embodying

claim-text.content: 13. A non-transitory computer-readable storage medium tangibly embodying a set of instructions, which when executed by one or more processors of a call mediation system of an Internet fax system, cause the one or more processors to perform a method comprising:

receiving, from a telecommunications system of the Internet fax system, an inbound fax call having associated therewith a source address, a destination address and a fax signal, wherein the destination address corresponds to a particular subscriber of the Internet fax system;

determining desired fax protocol technical call processing capabilities for processing the fax signal based on a plurality of the source address, the destination address and whether the inbound fax call was received through a circuit-switched or packet-switched connection;

identifying a subset of fax processing resources of a plurality of fax processing resources associated with the call mediation system that have the desired fax protocol technical call processing capabilities;

causing a digital representation of the fax signal to be delivered or otherwise made available to one or more users associated with the particular subscriber switching the inbound fax call to a selected fax processing resource of the subset of fax processing resources, which translates the fax signal into the digital representation.

claim.body: the call mediation system comprises a private branch exchange (PBX) and wherein said switching comprises calling a digital access cross connect system (DACS) logically interposed between the PBX and the fax processing resource.

content: 14. The non-transitory computer-readable storage medium of

, wherein the call mediation system comprises a private branch exchange (PBX) and wherein said switching comprises calling a digital access cross connect system (DACS) logically interposed between the PBX and the fax processing resource.

claim.body: the method further comprises remaining in a call path of the inbound fax call until completion of the inbound fax call and upon the completion recording billing information in a database.

content: 15. The non-transitory computer-readable storage medium of
, wherein the method further comprises remaining in a call path of the inbound fax call until completion of the inbound fax call and upon the completion recording billing information in a database.

claim-text.content: 16. An Internet fax system comprising:
a plurality of call mediation systems;
a plurality of fax processing resources associated with each of the plurality of call mediation systems;

a telecommunications system having a plurality of circuit and packet switched connections, the telecommunications system configured to receive an inbound fax call and switch the inbound fax call to a call mediation system of the plurality of call mediation systems, the inbound fax call having associated therewith a source address, a destination address and a fax signal, wherein the destination address corresponds to a particular subscriber of the Internet fax system;
wherein the call mediation system:

determines desired fax protocol technical call processing capabilities for processing the fax signal based on a plurality of the source address, the destination address and a type of connection of the plurality of circuit and packet switched connections through which the inbound fax call was received;
identifies a subset of fax processing resources of the plurality of fax processing resources that has the desired fax protocol technical call processing capabilities; and
switches the inbound fax call to a selected fax processing resource of the subset of fax processing resources; and

wherein the selected fax processing resource translates the fax signal into a digital representation causes the digital representation to be delivered or otherwise made available to one or more users associated with the particular subscriber.

claim.body: the telecommunications system performs round-robin load balancing among the plurality of call mediation systems.

content: 17. The Internet fax system of
, wherein the telecommunications system performs round-robin load balancing among the plurality of call mediation systems.
18. The Internet fax system of
, further comprising:

claim-text.content: a plurality of digital access cross connect systems (DACS) logically interposed between the plurality of call mediation systems and the plurality of fax processing resources;
wherein the plurality of call mediation systems comprise a plurality of private branch exchanges (PBXs); and
wherein a PBX of the plurality of PBXs to which the inbound call is switched further switches the inbound fax call to the selected fax processing resource by calling a DACS of the plurality of DACS.

claim.body: the PBX determines, based on one or more of the source address, the destination address and a specific circuit or packet switched connection of the plurality of circuit and packet switched connections through which the inbound fax call was received, whether to accept or reject the inbound fax call.

content: 19. The Internet fax system of

, wherein the PBX determines, based on one or more of the source address, the destination address and a specific circuit or packet switched connection of the plurality of circuit and packet switched connections through which the inbound fax call was received, whether to accept or reject the inbound fax call.

claim.body: the PBX remains in a call path of the inbound fax call until completion of the inbound fax call and upon the completion the PBX records billing information in a database.

content: 20. The Internet fax system of
, wherein the PBX remains in a call path of the inbound fax call until completion of the inbound fax call and upon the completion the PBX records billing information in a database.

claim.body: the selected fax server determines a delivery method to employ in connection with delivery of the digital representation to the one or more users based on the destination address or user account specific preferences associated with the one or more users.

content: 21. The Internet fax system of

, wherein the selected fax server determines a delivery method to employ in connection with delivery of the digital representation to the one or more users based on the destination address or user account specific preferences associated with the one or more users.

claim.body: the determined delivery method is electronic mail (email) delivery.

content: 22. The Internet fax system of
, wherein the determined delivery method is electronic mail (email) delivery.

claim.body: a web site and wherein the determined delivery method is delivery via the web site.

content: 23. The Internet fax system of
, further comprising a web site and wherein the determined delivery method is delivery via the web site.

claim.body: an application programming interface (API) and wherein the determined delivery method is delivery via the API.

, further comprising an application programming interface (API) and wherein the determined delivery method is delivery via the API.

claim.body: the API supports programmatic listing of a plurality of received faxes and programmatic downloading of a received fax of the plurality of received faxes.

content: 25. The Internet fax system of
, wherein the API supports programmatic listing of a plurality of received faxes and programmatic downloading of a received fax of the plurality of received faxes.

claim.body: the API is configured to receive a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or a HTTP secure (HTTPS) POST generated by an application of the subscriber that conveys a request for a list of received faxes.

content: 26. The Internet fax system of

, wherein the API is configured to receive a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or a HTTP secure (HTTPS) POST generated by an application of the subscriber that conveys a request for a list of received faxes.

claim.body: the API is configured to receive a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or a HTTP secure (HTTPS) POST generated by an application of the subscriber and conveying a request for retrieval of a particular received fax.

, wherein the API is configured to receive a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or a HTTP secure (HTTPS) POST generated by an application of the subscriber and conveying a request for retrieval of a particular received fax.
